pageContext.claim: “They've been talking about this for many, many years, and no administration has done anything. They've gotten taken to the cleaners. And I think we have a really meaningful relationship.”
pageContext.analysis: The Clinton, Bush and Obama administrations did try to deal with the North Korean issue. Clinton struck a deal, which Bush abandoned but then tried to negotiate a new one. Obama did not want to launch talks by making new concessions, as Bush did, so progress stalled. There are virtually no experts who ask why Trump is not moving faster. Instead, many say Trump is moving too fast, giving the North Korean dictator many concessions without receiving concrete results in turn.
